page.title: 06Bawdeswell Poultry Breeding
page.content: The Shaver Poultry Breeding Farms (GB) Ltd. is situated on Elsing Lane, which leads off to the south from the A1067. This complex of single story buildings is the European headquarters of the Shaver Organisation, whose head office is in Canada. Shavers produce grand- parent and parent breeding stock of brown egg layers, white egg layers and broilers, for breeding, both in Great Britain and for export. Shaver GB exports to approx. 30 countries. The premises consist of an office block with hatchery which could have an estimated output of 50,000 breeder chicks per week. The main breeding farm, with 11 chicken houses and a capacity of approx. 40,000 birds, adjoins this. The site covers about 7 acres and Shaver GB employs around 60 people, full and part-time included, drawn from a 13 mile radius.
